mdRecord.dcterms:title: Fire-Place and Secretary in Washington's Bed-Room
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Johnson, N. G. (Newton G.)
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stereoscopic view of the northwest corner of Washington's Chamber which includes a secretary bookcase and desk, fireplace and fireback, a rug and other furnishings. Mounted on orange board. The publisher's imprint on the front of the stereograph mount reads: N. G. Johnson, Photographer, 309 9th St., Washington, D. C. Only authorized Publisher of Mount Vernon Views. Label adhered on the reverse reads: The Fireplace in Washington's Bed room where he died and the old Mahogany Secretary used by him.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
George Washington's Mount Vernon
Washington's chamber
